author: wtopstaff
title: Mississippi-Memphis Preview Capsule
text:
By The Associated Press October 15, 2015 10:55 am 
No. 13 Mississippi (5-1) at Memphis (5-0), Noon (ABC) 
Line: Ole Miss by 10½. 
Series Record: Ole Miss leads 48-10-2 
WHAT’S AT STAKE 
Memphis has earned some national attention thanks to a 12-game winning streak. A win over Ole Miss — which is also a regional rival — would help the Tigers make the case that they’re the best program from the group of five conferences. The Rebels could use a win to gain momentum for a five-game stretch against Southeastern Conference opponents to end the regular season. 
KEY MATCHUP 
Memphis QB Paxton Lynch vs. Mississippi’s defense. Ole Miss DB Mike Hilton called Lynch one of the nation’s best-kept secrets after watching film this week. Lynch has been superb this year, throwing for 1,535 yards, 10 touchdowns and no interceptions. His 70.5 percent completion percentage ranks third nationally. 
PLAYERS TO WATCH 
Ole Miss: DB Trae Elston. The senior safety has been the Rebels’ biggest defensive playmaker this season. He has a team-high four interceptions, including two that were returned for touchdowns. 
Memphis: WR Mose Frazier. The veteran has been Lynch’s favorite target this season, catching 21 passes for 279 yards and two touchdowns. 
FACTS & FIGURES 
Memphis fourth-year coach Justin Fuente has a 22-20 record with the Tigers. He inherited a program that had a 5-31 record over the previous three seasons. … Memphis has only turned the ball over four times this season. That’s the fewest in the Football Bowl Subdivision. … Lynch has thrown for at least 300 yards in his past four games. … Ole Miss has scored 281 points through six games this season. The Rebels didn’t score that many points in five recent full seasons: 2011, 2007, 2006, 2005 and 2004. … The Memphis offense scores 47.8 points per game, which ranks fourth in the country. The Ole Miss offense is right behind at fifth with 46.8 points per game. Topics:
